Authors:
Zuzana Kolaříková, Renata Slavíková, Claudia Krüger,
Manuela Krüger, Petr Kohout
Title:
Putative distribution, ecology and phylogenetic placement of
a new uncultivable lineage within the order Archaeosporales,
Glomeromycota, as revealed by SMRT sequencing of a 2.5 kb fragment of
the ribosomal DNA
Abstract:
 There is no consensual barcoding region for determination
of arbuscular mycorrhizal fungal (AMF) taxa. To overcome this obstacle
we developed an approach to amplify and sequence the rDNA fragment of
AMF including all three widely applied variable molecular markers.  We
used a nested PCR approach specific for AMF to amplify part of the rDNA
spanning the majority of the SSU rRNA gene, complete ITS region and a
part of the LSU rRNA gene (~2.5 kb). The PCR products were sequenced on
the PacBio platform utilizing the Single Molecule Real Time (SMRT)
sequencing.  Employing this method for selected environmental DNA
samples, we were able to describe complex AMF communities consisting of
various glomeromycotan lineages.  We showed the applicability of this
new 2.5 kb approach to provide robust phylogenetic assignment of AMF
lineages without known sequences from pure cultures and to consolidate
information about AMF taxa distribution coming from three widely used
barcoding regions into one integrative dataset.
